title: Builcache fails to relocate xz
body:
Spack buildcache fails to relocate the `xz` package.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Set up the inital Spack instance:

```console
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack
$ source spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
```

2. Install `xz` package:

```console
$ spack install xz
```
3. Create binary for xz:

```console
$ spack buildcache create -au -d /tmp/localbuildcache xz
```

4. Set up a new spack instance in a different location:

```console
$ mkdir secondspack
$ cd secondspack
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack
$ source spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
```

5. Add local buildcache:

```console
$ spack mirror add local /tmp/localbuildcache/
$ spack mirror list
local    file:///tmp/localbuildcache/
```

6. Install `xz` from buildcache:

```console
$ spack buildcache install -u xz
==> Finding buildcaches in /tmp/localbuildcache//build_cache
==> Fetching file:///tmp/localbuildcache//build_cache/linux-centos7-x86_64-gcc-4.8.5-xz-5.2.4-agv5zlv7phi4ye3evlpv3t4ypgve4bpe.spec.yaml

```

### Error Message

The error message reported is empty (`==> Error:`) :

```console
$ spack -d --stacktrace buildcache install -u xz

lib/spack/spack/util/executable.py:159 ==> [2019-08-01-16:45:07.830899] '/path/secondspack/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/patchelf-0.9-ufwuiecywz2zepil46ifqlophnhwatbi/bin/patchelf' '--force-rpath' '--set-rpath' '/path/secondspack/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/xz-5.2.4-agv5zlv7phi4ye3evlpv3t4ypgve4bpe/lib:/path/secondspack/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/xz-5.2.4-agv5zlv7phi4ye3evlpv3t4ypgve4bpe/lib64' '/tmp/sftnight/tmp6llrJZ/xz-5.2.4-agv5zlv7phi4ye3evlpv3t4ypgve4bpe/bin/xz'
lib/spack/spack/binary_distribution.py:578 ==> [2019-08-01-16:45:08.095875] Error: 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/path/secondspack/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 697, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/path/secondspack/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 447, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/path/secondspack/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/buildcache.py", line 557, in buildcache
    args.func(args)
  File "/path/secondspack/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/buildcache.py", line 351, in installtarball
    install_tarball(match, args)
  File "/path/secondspack/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/buildcache.py", line 370, in install_tarball
    args.unsigned, args.force)
  File "/path/secondspack/spack/lib/spack/spack/binary_distribution.py", line 578, in extract_tarball
    tty.die(e)
  File "/path/secondspack/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/tty/__init__.py", line 225, in die
    sys.exit(1)
SystemExit: 1

```
 
The issue seems to come from the [`assert`](https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/cc4094bb9b6b228ef9c3821e9e76361df50b7f94/lib/spack/spack/relocate.py#L312) in the `replace_prefix_bin` that checks the length of the binary before and after applying the regex substitution.

The binary that triggers the issue is: `xz-5.2.4/bin/lzmainfo`. Before applying the substitution the lenght is:

```
(Pdb) print(len(data))
32376
```

And after the substitution it almost doubles:

```
(Pdb) print(len(data))
64603
```

### Information on your system

 1. Platform: Centos7, default compiler (gcc-4.8.5)

```
LSB Version:	:core-4.1-amd64:core-4.1-noarch
Distributor ID:	CentOS
Description:	CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810 (Core) 
Release:	7.6.1810
Codename:	Core
```

 2. No additional configuration.
